alert.note: Alert for Boise Mountains; Camas Prairie (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 2:53PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Elmore County through 315 PM MDT... At 252 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm with an outflow boundary near Pine, or 29 miles southeast of Idaho City, moving southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Prairie, Anderson Dam, Little Camas Reservoir and Cat Creek Summit around 310 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
